head.title: Metro Business Briefing; APARTMENT PRICES SOAR

hedline.hl1: Metro Business Briefing; APARTMENT PRICES SOAR

abstract.p: Price of Manhattan apartments rose by average of 19 percent in first quarter of year (S)

block.p: The price of Manhattan apartments rose by an average of 19 percent in the first quarter of this year, compared with the same period last year, according to a report released yesterday by the real estate firm Douglas Elliman. The firm reported that the average price of apartments below 116th Street was $876,612. However, the report found apartments staying on the market an average of 137 days, up 28 percent from a year ago. Susan Renfrew, the firm's director of sales on the East Side, attributed the continuing price increases to a dearth of available apartments.

The price of Manhattan apartments rose by an average of 19 percent in the first quarter of this year, compared with the same period last year, according to a report released yesterday by the real estate firm Douglas Elliman. The firm reported that the average price of apartments below 116th Street was $876,612. Susan Renfrew, the firm's director of sales on the East Side, attributed the continuing price increases to a dearth of available apartments.
